metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Vue v-bind Directive
You have already seen that a basic Vue setup consists of a Vue instance and that we can access it from the <div id="app"> tag with {{ }} or the v-bind directive.
content.html: You have already seen that a basic Vue setup consists of a Vue instance and that we can access it from the <div id="app"> tag with {{ }} or the v-bind directive.

content.text: On this page we will explain the v-bind directive in more detail.
content.html: On this page we will explain the v-bind directive in more detail.

content.text: The v-bind Directive
The v-bind directive lets us bind an HTML attribute to data in the Vue instance. This makes it easy to change the attribute value dynamically.
content.html: The v-bind directive lets us bind an HTML attribute to data in the Vue instance. This makes it easy to change the attribute value dynamically.

content.code_html: <div v-bind:[attribute]="[Vue data]"></div>
<img v-bind:src="url">

content.text: CSS Binding

We can use the v-bind directive to do in-line styling and modify classes dynamically. We will show you briefly how to do that in this section, and later in this tutorial, on the CSS Binding page , we will explain this in more detail.
content.html: We can use the v-bind directive to do in-line styling and modify classes dynamically. We will show you briefly how to do that in this section, and later in this tutorial, on the CSS Binding page, we will explain this in more detail.

content.text: Bind style
In-line styling with Vue is done by binding the style attribute to Vue with v-bind .
content.html: In-line styling with Vue is done by binding the style attribute to Vue with v-bind.

content.text: As a value to the v-bind directive, we can write a JavaScript object with the CSS property and value:
content.html: As a value to the v-bind directive, we can write a JavaScript object with the CSS property and value:

content.code_html:
<div v-bind:style="{ fontSize: size }">
  Text example
</div>

content.text: We can also separate the font size number value from the font size unit if we want to, like this:
content.html: We can also separate the font size number value from the font size unit if we want to, like this:

content.code_html:
<div v-bind:style="{ fontSize: size + 'px' }">
  Text example
</div>

content.text: We could also write the CSS property name with CSS syntax (kebab-case) in hyphens, but it is not recommended:
content.html: We could also write the CSS property name with CSS syntax (kebab-case) in hyphens, but it is not recommended:

content.code_html:
<div v-bind:style="{ 'font-size': size + 'px' }">
  Text example
</div>

content.code: Notice the background color on this div tag.
content.code_html:
<div v-bind:style="{ backgroundColor: 'hsl('+bgVal+',80%,80%)' }">
  Notice the background color on this div tag.
</div>

content.code: Conditional background color
content.code_html:
<div v-bind:style="{ backgroundColor: isImportant ? 'lightcoral' : 'lightgray' }">
  Conditional background color
</div>

content.text: Bind class
We can use v-bind to change the class attribute.
content.html: We can use v-bind to change the class attribute.

content.text: The value of v-bind:class can be a variable:
content.html: The value of v-bind:class can be a variable:

content.code: The class is set with Vue
content.code_html:
<div v-bind:class="className">
  The class is set with Vue
</div>

content.text: The value of v-bind:class can also be an object, where the class name will only take effect if it is set to 'true':
content.html: The value of v-bind:class can also be an object, where the class name will only take effect if it is set to 'true':

content.code: The class is set conditionally to change the background color
content.code_html:
<div v-bind:class="{ myClass: true }">
  The class is set conditionally to change the background color
</div>

content.text: When the value of v-bind:class is an object, the class can be assigned depending on a Vue property:
content.html: When the value of v-bind:class is an object, the class can be assigned depending on a Vue property:

content.code: The class is set conditionally to change the background color
content.code_html:
<div v-bind:class="{ myClass: isImportant }">
  The class is set conditionally to change the background color
</div>

content.text: Shorthand for v-bind
The shorthand for ' v-bind: ' is simply ' : '.

content.code: The class is set conditionally to change the background color
content.code_html:
<div :class="{ impClass: isImportant }">
  The class is set conditionally to change the background color
</div>

content.text: We will continue to use v-bind: syntax in this tutorial to avoid confusion.
content.html: We will continue to use v-bind: syntax in this tutorial to avoid confusion.

content.text: Vue Exercises
Test Yourself With Exercises
Exercise:
Provide the missing code so that the class is set equal to the 'className' data property, using a Vue directive shorthand.
content.html: Provide the missing code so that the class is set equal to the 'className' data property, using a Vue directive shorthand.

content.code: The class is set with Vue
content.code_html:
<div ="className">
  The class is set with Vue
</div>

content.text: Start the Exercise
